items.title: Stocks Slip and Gold Rises as U.S. Government Shutdown Takes Effect
items.summary: Investors have typically been unfazed by government closures, but the longer a shutdown runs, the greater the chance of longer-lasting effects.

items.title: What Are the Effects of a Government Shutdown?
items.summary: Ben Casselman, the chief economics correspondent for The New York Times, describes the economic effects of a government shutdown.

items.title: Democrats See No Need to Capitulate, Nor Republicans to Cut a Deal
items.summary: The last time Senate Democrats found themselves taking the blame for a government shutdown, they quickly caved. That’s less likely to happen now.

items.title: Full Federal Appeals Court to Hear Alien Enemies Act Case
items.summary: The decision vacated a finding by a panel of the court’s judges regarding President Trump’s use of the Alien Enemies Act to deport immigrants, but did not clear the way for such expulsions to resume.

items.title: Judge Disqualifies Nevada’s Acting U.S. Attorney From Handling Cases
items.summary: A federal judge said Sigal Chattah was not “validly serving as acting U.S. attorney.” The Trump administration had appointed her to the post in a way that circumvented federal procedures.

items.title: US government shutdown live: first closure since 2018 begins after funding bill fails
items.summary: <p>Competing bills rejected in Senate as Republicans and Democrats accuse each other of partisan politics</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/01/us-government-shuts-down">US government shuts down</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/ng-interactive/2025/sep/30/us-senate-government-funding-votes">Tracker: how each US senator voted</a></p></li></ul><p>This shutdown is expected to be worse than previous ones. The impact on federal workers could be even more severe.</p><p>Before Trump’s most recent threat of mass layoffs on Tuesday, a memo released last week by the White House’s office of management and budget told agencies not just to prepare for temporary furloughs <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/25/trump-administration-government-shutdown">but for permanent layoffs</a> in the event of a shutdown.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/01/us-government-shutdown-update-2025-shutting-funding-trump-democrats-republicans-live-updates-latest-news">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan
items.summary: <p>First shutdown in nearly seven years as Republicans accused of ‘risking America’s healthcare’ in spending bill</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/01/us-government-shutdown-update-2025-shutting-funding-trump-democrats-republicans-live-updates-latest-news">US government shutdown – live updates</a></p></li></ul><p>The US government shut down on Wednesday, after congressional Democrats refused to support a Republican plan to extend funding for federal departments unless they won a series of concessions centered on healthcare.</p><p>The GOP, which controls the Senate and the House of Representatives, repudiated their demands, setting off a legislative scramble that lasted into the hours before funding lapsed at midnight, when the Senate failed to advance both parties’ bills to keep funding going.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/01/us-government-shuts-down">Continue reading...</a>
